p: Indian gamboge is rich in seed oil (38.08 g/100 g [ 32]), and it has been reported that the amount of oil present in the seeds of this plant is higher than the seed oil content of mangosteen [ 33]. The seed oil of Indian gamboge is used as a cooking oil and in confectionery [ 1]. The fatty acid composition of Indian gamboge was analyzed in seed oil [ 32, 34] and stearic acid (44.95%) and oleic acid (45.38%) were identified as the major fatty acids; in addition, the oil contained myristic acid, palmitic acid, behenic acid, and heptadecanoic acid in smaller quantities ( Table 3).
